text: An oath of fealty is a pledge of allegiance of one person to another. In medieval Europe, the swearing of fealty is an oath made by a peasant to his lord. "Fealty" also referred to the duties that a servant need to perform. These includes service and help.Coredon A Dictionary of Medieval Terms and Phrases p. 120 ==References== * * * Category:Feudalism
title: Fealty
